intro: Nototriche stenopetala, commonly known as the narrow-petalled nototriche, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant features small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are finely divided and often have a strong, spicy scent. Nototriche stenopetala is typically found in high-altitude grasslands and is adapted to the cool, moist climates of its native habitat.
